text: It is sometimes necessary to do something unforgivable in order to be able to go on living.
author: Hayao Miyazaki

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: Look at the stars and not at your feet.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: The mighty oak was once a little nut that held its ground.
author: Proverb

text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
author: Peter Marshall

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The journey of a lifetime starts with the turning of a page.
author: Rachel Anders

text: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: It's not the strength of the body that counts, but the strength of the spirit.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of a mistake.
author: Buckminster Fuller

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Action is the antidote to despair.
author: Joan Baez

text: You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: First we make our habits, then our habits make us.
author: Charles C. Noble

text: The soul always knows what to do to heal itself. The challenge is to silence the mind.
author: Caroline Myss

text: We do not learn from experience... we learn from reflecting on experience.
author: John Dewey

text: Leaders are made, they are not born. They are made by hard effort.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Will Durant

text: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Your focus determines your reality.
author: Qui-Gon Jinn (Star Wars)

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: For every minute spent organizing, an hour is earned.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I'm a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

text: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Little strokes fell great oaks.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Celebrate any progress. Don't wait to get perfect.
author: Ann McGee Cooper

text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

text: With realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
author: Dalai Lama

text: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
author: Aeschylus

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Will Durant

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: The person who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

text: The function of freedom is to free someone else.
author: Toni Morrison

text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: The human capacity for burden is like bamboo — far more flexible than you'd ever believe at first glance.
author: Jodi Picoult

text: The past is a ghost, the future a dream. All we ever have is now.
author: Bill Cosby

text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Saint Augustine

text: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
author: Nathaniel Branden

text: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
author: Carl Rogers

text: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
author: Aristotle

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: The sun himself is weak when he first rises, and gathers strength and courage as the day gets on.
author: Charles Dickens

text: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: The greatest risk is not taking one.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

text: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The greatest prayer is patience.
author: Buddha

text: The flower that blooms in adversity is the rarest and most beautiful of all.
author: Walt Disney

text: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

text: The universe is not made of atoms; it's made of tiny stories.

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

text: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
author: Socrates

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
author: Jimmy Johnson

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The greatest freedom is to be free of our own mind.
author: Osho

text: The journey is the reward.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The past has no power over the present moment.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: The greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: The art of life is to live in the present moment.
author: Emmet Fox

text: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
author: W.B. Yeats

text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
author: Jordan Belfort

text: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
author: William James

text: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The greatest lessons in life are usually learned at the worst times and from the worst mistakes.
author: Anonymous

text: The purpose of our lives is to add value to the people of this generation and those that will follow.
author: Buckminster Fuller

text: The future is already here — it's just not evenly distributed.
author: William Gibson

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life — to be happy — it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: The only real luxury is time. You can't get it back.
author: Alessandro Squarzi

text: The strongest people are not those who show strength in front of us but those who win battles we know nothing about.
author: Jonathan Harnisch

text: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
author: Socrates

text: The greatest gift you can give someone is your time because when you give your time, you are giving a portion of your life that you will never get back.
author: Anonymous

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.

text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
author: Anne Frank

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.

text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.

text: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
